org.red5.server.api
Interface Client

All Superinterfaces:
AttributeStore
All Known Implementing Classes:
Client
public interface Client
extends AttributeStore

The client object represents a single client. One client may have multiple connections to different scopes on the same host. In some ways the client object is like a HTTP session. NOTE: I removed session, since client serves the same purpose as a client with attributes

Author:
The Red5 Project (red5@osflash.org), Luke Hubbard (luke@codegent.com)

Field Summary
static java.lang.String HTTP_SESSION_KEY
          The key used to store the client object in a http session

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Get the unique ID for this client, this will be generated by the server if not passed with connect

Returns:
String containing the id

getHost

public java.lang.String getHost()
Get the hostname that the client connected to. If they connected to an IP, the IP address will be returned as a String.

Returns:
String containing the hostname

getCreationTime

public long getCreationTime()
Get the creation time for this client object

Returns:
long representing the time in milliseconds when this object was created

lookupConnection

public Connection lookupConnection(Scope scope)
Lookup a connection associated with a given scope

Parameters:
scope - the current scope object
Returns:
connection the associated connection object
